stories.text:
I am a software engineer early in my career with about 4-5 years of experience.

I am looking for someone to mentor me, to provide valuable insight and advice on possible career paths and direction I can take.

One of the things that every article about mentor-mentee relationship mentions is that its supposed to be mutually beneficial and when I ask the person to be my mentor, I mention why they should mentor me.

I understand the value that a mentor provides me but I don't see any possible value they can get from helping me out.

What value do you get from mentoring someone in my position ?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why will you mentor me?

stories.text: All engineers know what it's like to be bombarded by recruiters wanting some of their time.  So pay us for our time to do your interviews.
stories.title: It's time recruiters start paying engineers directly to take their phone calls
